page.title: 14RELIGION-CHURCHES
page.content:
There are four churches within this area, St. Mary's Barking, St. Catherine's Ringshall, St. Mary's Battisford, and the Free Church, Barking.
St. Mary's Barking: There has been a church on this site since Saxon times. About 1250 a flint rubble building was erected, of which the vestry, chancel, and parts of the tower and nave still stand. From 1350 over a period of 200 years, the church was enlarged, and is now over-large for the small village it now serves. Until 1901 it was the mother church of Needham Market, during which time the coffins would be carried on foot along the Causeway or Corpseway.
